title: User Registration and Login Success
description: Verify that users can register and log in successfully with valid credentials using Clerk authentication.

steps.description: Navigate to the user registration page.
Input valid user data for registration.
Submit the registration form.
Assert that registration completes successfully and user is redirected to login.
Navigate to login page.
Input the registered username/email and password.
Click the login button.
Check that login is successful and user is granted access to tenant resources.

title: User Login Failure with Invalid Credentials
description: Verify login fails with invalid username/password combinations and appropriate error messages are displayed.

steps.description: Navigate to login page.
Input invalid username/email and/or password.
Click login button.
Verify login is rejected and error message about invalid credentials is shown.

title: Multi-Tenant Account Creation With Branding
description: Ensure users can create new tenant accounts with isolated data and configure initial branding with custom logos and colors.

steps.description: Log in as a user with permissions to create tenant accounts.
Navigate to account creation page.
Fill in required tenant details and upload branding elements (logo, color scheme).
Submit account creation form.
Verify tenant account is created with isolated data storage.
Verify branding is applied correctly to UI components.

title: Custom Domain Configuration with DNS Verification
description: Test setting up a custom domain for a tenant and perform DNS verification successfully.

steps.description: Log in as tenant admin.
Navigate to domain management settings.
Add a new custom domain and trigger DNS verification.
Verify DNS verification process completes successfully and domain is assigned.
Check UI reflects the custom domain in tenant branding.

title: Bucket CRUD Operations with Versioning and Lifecycle Policies
description: Validate creating, reading, updating, and deleting storage buckets including enabling versioning and setting lifecycle policies.

steps.description: Log in as tenant user with bucket management permissions.
Navigate to bucket management page.
Create a new bucket with valid parameters.
Verify the bucket is created and listed.
Enable versioning on the bucket.
Confirm versioning status is updated.
Define and apply lifecycle policies for data expiration or transition.
Verify lifecycle policies are saved and enforced.
Update bucket metadata such as name or access policies.
Ensure updates are persisted correctly.
Delete the bucket.
Confirm the bucket is removed and no longer accessible.

title: Access Key Management: Creation, Rotation, Revocation, and Permissions
description: Test creation, rotation, revocation, and permission changes of S3-compatible access keys ensuring correct enforcement and logging.

steps.description: Log in as a user with access key management rights.
Navigate to access keys page.
Create a new access key with specific permission sets.
Verify the new key is generated and permissions are correct.
Rotate the secret of an existing access key.
Confirm the key's secret has changed and old secret is invalid.
Revoke an access key.
Verify the key is disabled and cannot be used for authentication.
Update permissions on an existing key.
Ensure the permission updates are enforced correctly during API access.

title: Team Member Invitation, Role Assignment, and Permission Controls
description: Verify inviting team members, assigning roles (owner, admin, developer), and enforcing permission restrictions accordingly.

steps.description: Log in as tenant owner or admin.
Navigate to team management page.
Send an invitation to a new user via email.
Confirm the invitation is sent and recorded.
New user accepts the invitation and joins the team.
Verify new team member appears in the list with the correct default role.
Change the role of existing team members to admin or developer.
Check that role changes update permissions correctly.
Attempt actions restricted for current role to ensure access control enforcement.

title: Billing Workflow: Plan Selection, Subscription, Invoice Generation and Payment
description: Test the full billing lifecycle including selecting plans, managing subscription states, invoice creation, and payment tracking.

steps.description: Log in as a tenant billing manager.
Navigate to billing page and select a product plan.
Subscribe to selected plan.
Verify subscription is active with correct plan details.
Trigger invoice generation for billing cycle.
Check invoice is generated with accurate amounts and details.
Simulate payment of invoice.
Confirm payment is recorded and subscription state is updated.
Cancel subscription and verify billing state updates appropriately.

title: Quota Request and Approval Workflow
description: Verify users can request storage quota increases, administrators can approve or reject requests, and status is updated accordingly.

steps.description: Tenant user submits a quota increase request with justification.
Check the request appears in admin dashboard for review.
Admin reviews and approves the quota request.
Verify quota is increased for tenant and user is notified.
Admin rejects a quota request and provides reason.
Confirm tenant user receives rejection notification with reason.

title: SFTP Credential Creation and Password Reset
description: Test creation of SFTP credentials per tenant, password reset flows, and logging of usage events.

steps.description: Log in as tenant user with SFTP credential management rights.
Create new SFTP credentials assigned to specific tenant.
Verify credentials are created and stored securely.
Reset password for existing SFTP credential.
Confirm password reset is processed and updated.
Check audit logs include creation and reset events with user and timestamp.

title: Notification System Delivery and User Interaction
description: Validate that in-app notifications are delivered correctly, support different types, and read/unread statuses update on user interaction.

steps.description: Trigger notifications of various types (quota alerts, payment reminders, activity alerts) for a tenant user.
Verify notifications appear in the bell icon dropdown.
Mark certain notifications as read.
Ensure read/unread status updates persist and UI reflects changes.
Dismiss notifications and confirm they are removed from view.

title: Audit Logs Capture and Review by Authorized Users
description: Ensure that all critical system and user actions (account changes, key rotations, billing events) are recorded with metadata and accessible by authorized roles.

steps.description: Perform various actions: create account, rotate key, change team roles, generate invoices.
Verify audit logs record each action with user identity, timestamp, and relevant details.
Log in as user without audit permission and attempt to access audit logs.
Confirm access is denied.
Log in as authorized user and navigate to audit logs page.
Verify audit logs are searchable, sortable, and display accurate metadata.

title: White-label Customization Application in UI and Email Templates
description: Validate that tenant-specific white-label configurations (logo, colors, favicon, SMTP settings) propagate correctly throughout the UI and email templates.

steps.description: Configure tenant branding including custom logo, color scheme, and favicon.
Verify these branding elements appear on tenant UI pages consistently.
Setup SMTP email configuration per tenant.
Trigger an outbound email (notification or billing) to a user.
Ensure email uses the tenant's customized templates and branding.

title: API Endpoint Response Time and Error Handling
description: Test that all backend API endpoints respond within defined SLA limits and handle invalid input/errors gracefully with proper validation.

steps.description: Send valid API requests covering all core operations (accounts, buckets, keys, billing, team).
Measure response times and verify they meet SLA (e.g., under 500ms).
Send invalid API requests with malformed or missing data.
Check API returns appropriate error status codes and messages without exposing sensitive information.
Check that rate limiting rejects excessive requests with proper responses.

title: Role-based Access Control Enforcement and Tenant Isolation
description: Verify that role-based access controls strictly isolate tenant data and prevent cross-tenant data leakage or unauthorized permission escalation.

steps.description: Log in as tenant A user and attempt to access tenant B data via UI and API.
Ensure access is denied and no tenant B data is exposed.
Attempt to perform actions above assigned role permissions (e.g., developer tries admin-only actions).
Verify these actions are blocked with appropriate error notifications.
Attempt to escalate permissions by direct API or UI manipulation.
Confirm attempts are rejected and logged.

title: Frontend UI Workflow Validation for Dashboard, Team, Billing, and Storage
description: Confirm that the frontend UI provides modular, responsive, and intuitive workflows for all major features, leveraging Radix UI, TailwindCSS, and shadcn/ui components.

steps.description: Navigate through dashboard pages and verify overview metrics and quick actions function as expected.
Test team management UI flows including invitations, role updates, and removals.
Exercise billing UI including plan selection, invoice views, and subscription management.
Use storage management screens to create, modify, and delete buckets.
Check UI responsiveness on various screen sizes and input correctness feedback.

title: Security of Sensitive Data Storage and Transmission
description: Ensure all sensitive information such as passwords and secret keys are hashed or encrypted securely both in storage and transit.

steps.description: Create or update user credentials and access keys.
Verify that sensitive data is not stored in plaintext in databases.
Intercept API calls to check transmission security.
Confirm data is transmitted over secure channels (e.g., HTTPS/TLS).

title: Admin Dashboard Management and Quota Approvals
description: Validate super admin functionalities including tenant account management, product and pricing setup, and quota request approvals without permission escalation risks.

steps.description: Log in as super admin.
Navigate to admin dashboard for tenant account management.
Create, update, and suspend tenant accounts.
Verify changes propagate correctly without affecting unrelated tenants.
Manage product catalog and pricing tiers.
Confirm pricing changes are saved and reflected in billing flows.
Review and approve/reject tenant quota increase requests.
Check status updates and notifications are sent appropriately.
Attempt unauthorized actions and verify no permission escalation occurs.

title: System Stability and Performance Under Load
description: Conduct performance testing to ensure system stability, responsiveness, and proper operation of monitoring and rate limiting.

steps.description: Simulate concurrent users performing core operations simultaneously.
Verify system remains stable with acceptable latency and throughput.
Trigger rate limiting by exceeding request thresholds.
Confirm rate limits activate and reject excessive requests safely.
Check monitoring dashboards and alerts are updated accordingly.
